title: What should I do in Review?
content:
Review and categorize the terms the system has discovered from the input files. Terms that are known the systems are pre-categorized into the category boxes on the right (shown in brown). You can change those decisions.

How to categorize?
Move character-bearing terms from the left panel to the category boxes on the right by drag-and-drop or through the pop-up menus invoked by a right-click on a term.

Please also synonymize synonyms.

Terms left uncategorized will not be used in tagging characters.

If the task is shared with others, the latest result among all users of a shared task is shown for each of the user.

title: (Un)Categorize terms
content:
Two ways to categorize a term:
1. Drag the term from left and drop it in the yellow area in an appropriate category box.
2. Right-click on a term to invoke its popup menu.

Two ways to uncategorize a term:
1. Drag the term from a category box and drop it in the left term list.
2. Right-click on the term to invoke its popup menu, then select Categorize > Remove.

title: Discard categorization results
content:
In case you want to discard all categorization results -- empty all category boxes and return terms to the left panel:
File menu, Remove Categorizations > All

If you want to just discard users' categorization results, which will keep the system's categorization in place but remove your and your sharee's imported and manual categorizations:
File menu, Remove Categorization > Users categorizations.

title: Terms not describing characters
content:
The system may list 'bad' terms (not useful for describing any character) for you to categorize. Two ways to deal with these terms:
1. Simply leave them uncategorized.
2. Move them to Trash folder in the left panel, by drag-and-drop or invoking a pop-up menu by right-click on the term.

title: Make synonyms
content:
If two terms are synonyms or alternative spellings, you should make them synonyms by dragging term 1 onto term 2. Term 2 will be considered a preferred term (marked with a folder icon), holding all its synonyms, e.g., term 1.

To break up a synonym relation, right-click on the preferred term (marked with a folder icon) to invoke its popup menu, select Synonymize, then Remove Synonyms or Remove All Synonyms. The released synonyms will remain in the same category.

title: Terms belong to multiple categories
content:
A term can be categorized into multiple categories if needed.

If the term is currently uncategorized, right-click on the term to invoke its popup menu, then select Categorize > Categorize to and select appropriate categories.

If the term is categorized, drag and drop the term to additional desired categories and select Copy when prompted, or right-click on the term to invoke its popup menu, then select Categorize > Copy to and select appropriate categories.

title: Correct typos and add comments
content:
To correct typos, right-click on a term to invoke its popup menu, select Term > Correct Spelling.

To comment on a term, right-click on a term to invoke its popup menu, select Term > Comment. You can view all the comments made on the current set of terms using the Comments menu.

title: Create a new category
content:
To add a new category to the right panel, right-click on white space anywhere in the Categories and Categorization Results area to invoke its popup menu, and select Category > Add. Provide a definition for the category you created.

Caution: All terms in category boxes will be used to generate characters for a taxon-character matrix. Please do not create temporary convenient categories such as 'difficult terms', 'misspellings' etc. Good categories are characters your organisms have with a set of known states.

title: View term information
content:
Term Information area, located at the lower part of the screen, provides you additional information about the terms.

Locations tab: shows the categories a selected term currently is in.
Context tab: shows the source sentences where a selected term appears in the input descriptions.
Ontologies tab: shows the definitions of a selected term in BioPortal ontologies.

You can include ontologies of your choice by using the Ontologies menu on the menu bar - including too many ontologies will slow down system responding time. The ontologies selected are not used in subsequence processing steps at this time.

title: Search terms
content: Use the Search menu on the main menu bar. Search results will be shown in the Locations tab.
